comment: Class is extremely boring and not useful. VERY lecture heavy!!! She loves to call on people to participate. Everyone is always confused. Really only graded on 4 assignments, that are very time consuming and hard. She is unorganized, her syllabus, D2l, and rubrics all say different things. No clear guidelines/directions. Didn't learn anything.

she will use all of the 2hours and 45 minutes to lecture, she gives only a five minute break and is very strict on participating, if you don't she will not have a problem calling you out. she is blunt and condescending, if you are introverted and sensitive I would advise to go with a different prof. she is not that bad or good she is just okay.

Really boring class. Very lecture heavy and usually the class is left very confused on what is being asked of us, during class. Easy class though. Work load was manageble just didn't feel useful. I was excited for this assessment class but so far havent learned anything I can take with me to my future classrooms.

I absolutely love Dr. Alviar!! She is so sweet and really wants to see her students achieve. Her class is not stressful at all. There are four assignments & a few discussion posts, very easy to achieve. Assignments are spaced out and you have time to actually learn & process information. Take her!!! You will not regret it. Awesome professor!!

Looking at the other reviews, you already know you need a 92+ to get an A and there are only 4 assignments. She's super nice and understanding. I took her synchronously so it felt like the lectures could be put in a powerpoint every month or so. The class is not hard. Just try your best and you'll be fine.

There are only four assignments in the class. One assignment is a group project. She requires that you turn it a draft before submitting the actual assignment so you can receive feedback. The assignments connect to what we are learning and are spread out throughout the semester.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: I do not recommend. Got an A , but I barely passed to her standards. You need a 92+ to pass. There are 4 assignments, but each is major to your grade. There is a rubric for each assignment, but she takes points off even if you meet the rubric. Attend class and participate- it helps your grade! Overall, she does not make virtual learning any better.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Alviar is a very tough grader. No one in our class received a perfect grade in anything. The way she speaks to you is very rude and condescending. you have to get a 92 to get an A in the class which is very hard to do with only having 4 assignments graded. However, she did offer extra credit at the end which i am thankful for. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: I was really excited about taking her course, however was very disappointed. There are 4 assignments total and she waited until the last 2 weeks for us to complete the last 2. Honestly way too strict of a grader and her feedback rarely makes sense. Just skip unless you want to be confused and stressed

This was a good class. Sometimes it was boring at 8 am, but she did her best to get us engaged. She is very caring and listens to the needs of her students. The assignments are LONG, but the are necessary. She gives amazing feedback even before you turn something in to help you succeed. It is amazing and I appreciated it so much. I would take again
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria
